segment.source: Create a Group Account in Active Directory (Windows 10)
segment.target: Create a Group Account in Active Directory (Windows 10)

segment.source: Create a Group Account in Active Directory
segment.target: Create a Group Account in Active Directory

segment.source: Create a Group Account in Active Directory
segment.target: Create a Group Account in Active Directory

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: To create a security group to contain the computer accounts for the computers that are to receive a set of Group Policy settings, use the Active Directory Users and Computers console.
segment.target: To create a security group to contain the computer accounts for the computers that are to receive a set of Group Policy settings, use the Active Directory Users and Computers console.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete this procedure, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to create new group accounts.
segment.target: To complete this procedure, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to create new group accounts.

segment.source: To add a new membership group in Active Directory
segment.target: To add a new membership group in Active Directory

segment.source: Open the Active Directory Users and Computers console.
segment.target: Open the Active Directory Users and Computers console.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, select the container in which you want to store your group.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, select the container in which you want to store your group.

segment.source: This is typically the Users container under the domain.
segment.target: This is typically the Users container under the domain.

segment.source: Click Action, click New, and then click Group.
segment.target: Click Action, click New, and then click Group.

segment.source: In the Group name text box, type the name for your new group.
segment.target: In the Group name text box, type the name for your new group.

segment.source: Note: Be sure to use a name that clearly indicates its purpose.
segment.target: Note: Be sure to use a name that clearly indicates its purpose.

segment.source: Check to see if your organization has a naming convention for groups.
segment.target: Check to see if your organization has a naming convention for groups.

segment.source: In the Description text box, enter a description of the purpose of this group.
segment.target: In the Description text box, enter a description of the purpose of this group.

segment.source: In the Group scope section, select either Global or Universal, depending on your Active Directory forest structure.
segment.target: In the Group scope section, select either Global or Universal, depending on your Active Directory forest structure.

segment.source: If your group must include computers from multiple domains, then select Universal.
segment.target: If your group must include computers from multiple domains, then select Universal.

segment.source: If all of the members are from the same domain, then select Global.
segment.target: If all of the members are from the same domain, then select Global.

segment.source: In the Group type section, click Security.
segment.target: In the Group type section, click Security.

segment.source: Click OK to save your group.
segment.target: Click OK to save your group.
